# b00tl3gRSA2
# Objetivo
In RSA d is a lot bigger than e, why don't we use d to encrypt instead of e? Connect with `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 19566`.
# Solución
son los datos que devuelve el comando para el reto:
```
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~]
└─$ nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 19566 
c: 
n: 
e: 

```

Lo que realice para resolver el reto en python3:
nota: se remplaza la 'e' por  'd' y la e toma el valor por defecto 65537 
```
Python 3.11.4 (main, Jun  7 2023, 10:13:09) [GCC 12.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> c = 
>>> n = 
>>> d = 
>>> e = 65537
>>> m = pow(c, d, n)
>>> m

>>> from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes
>>> m = pow(c, e, n)
>>> m
180638594769037903267909311328535969949661653321164402927482237
>>> long_to_byte(m)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
NameError: name 'long_to_byte' is not defined. Did you mean: 'long_to_bytes'?
>>> long_to_bytes(m)
b'picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_2438125}'

```
picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_2438125}
